description: {"blocks":[{"key":"rbon","text":"This protocol describes how to determine microglucosuria in patients living with sickle cell disease in order to diagnose a nephropathy as a result of proximal convoluted tubule damaged by heme catabolites.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation:
Ndour EHM, Mnika K, Tall FG, Seck M, Ly ID, Nembaware V, et al. (2022) Biomarkers of sickle cell nephropathy in Senegal. PLoS ONE

17(11): e0273745. https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0273745

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"n77p","text":". OBJECTIVE","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8rsbm","text":"The aim is to describe how microglucosuria is determined.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eetam","text":"SAMPLING","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7p81d","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29t1l","text":"Urine ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ei0ds","text":"A meadstream voiding urine sample at random  at any time between 8 a.m. and 2 p.m. is collected. The urine sample is centrifuged before performing the test on the same day of collection with the undiluted supernatant.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5fcs","text":"PRINCIPLE ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adp7n","text":"Several methods can be used, including hexokinase, glucose oxidase or glucose dehydrogenase. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1dsn","text":"The method used in this work is that of glucose oxidase / peroxidase whose principle is as follows: ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmu1i","text":"Glucose, under the action of glucose-oxidase, is oxidized to gluconic acid with formation of hydrogen peroxide. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ikb7","text":"In the presence of peroxidase, the hydrogen peroxide produced transforms a colorless reduced chromogen into an oxidized chromogen colored pink whose intensity of coloration measurable by spectrophotometry at 505 nm is proportional to the glucose concentration of the sample.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7s099","text":"                                      Glucose oxydase","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rcb","text":"Glucose + O2 + H2O --------------------------→ Acide gluconique + H2O2","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":11,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":16,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":67,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":69,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7q43","text":"                                                                    Peroxydase","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"co9vo","text":"H2O2 + phénol + amino 4 phenazone ----------------------→ Quinone imine + 2 H2O","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":1,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":3,"length":2},{"style":"sub","offset":77,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qhth","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"79jf6","text":"PROCEDURE","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ct6ro","text":"-Place the reagents at room temperature for 5 minutes.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nf8b","text":"-Pipette in test tubes according to the following table:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9aktt","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1g5o6","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lm2f","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14rso","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2022m","text":"            Blanc      Standard      Control      Sample        Blanc      -      -      -      -        Standard      -      10 µl      -      -        Control      -      -      10 µl      -        Sample      -      -      -      10 µl        Reagent       1 ml      1 ml      1 ml      1 ml   ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":297}],"data":{}},{"key":"6i3mq","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79ld4","text":"-Shake well and incubate the tubes for 10 minutes at room temperature or for 5 minutes 37°C. A pink coloration is obtained (stable at least 1 hour).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ffua","text":"   -Read the concentrations by spectrophotometer at 505 nm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5p232","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a891v","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajfgu","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eeruf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","0_4":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","1_4":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","2_4":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","3_3":"","3_4":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":"","4_3":"","4_4":"","5_0":"","5_1":"","5_2":"","5_3":"","5_4":""},"colTitles":[],"colWidths":[90,90,90,90,90],"data":[["     ","  Blanc  ","  Standard  ","  Control  ","  Sample  "],["  Blanc  ","  -  ","  -  ","  -  ","  -  "],["  Standard  ","  -  ","  10 µl  ","  -  ","  -  "],["  Control  ","  -  ","  -  ","  10 µl  ","  -  "],["  Sample  ","  -  ","  -  ","  -  ","  10 µl  "],["  Reagent   ","  1 ml  ","  1 ml  ","  1 ml  ","  1 ml  "]],"guid":"D0D7A5409E5511EC9B370A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":[],"printData":[["     ","  Blanc  ","  Standard  ","  Control  ","  Sample  "],["  Blanc  ","  -  ","  -  ","  -  ","  -  "],["  Standard  ","  -  ","  10 µl  ","  -  ","  -  "],["  Control  ","  -  ","  -  ","  10 µl  ","  -  "],["  Sample  ","  -  ","  -  ","  -  ","  10 µl  "],["  Reagent   ","  1 ml  ","  1 ml  ","  1 ml  ","  1 ml  "]],"rowHeights":[]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3i6cb","text":"RESULTS","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3prki","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9p7jm","text":"The urine of a healthy subject does not contain glucose. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4h9v9","text":"INTERPRETATION","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cn08a","text":"To interpret glucosuria, the RGCU (urinary glucose/creatinine ratio) which is the ratio of glucosuria (mg/l) to creatininuria (g/l) is first calculated.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"751m6","text":"If RGCU ˂ 20 mg/g, it is called physiological glucosuria.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejk59","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9uiea","text":"If the RGCU ≥ 20 mg/g, with test strip results indicating an absence of glucose in the urine, it is called microglucosuria.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":123}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36mqi","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"700t3","text":"If RGCU ≥ 20 mg/g with test strip results indicating the presence of glucose in the urine, this is called glucosuria.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Determination of microglucosuria
